availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. Bullock (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary E. Gardner Bullock in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on October 11, 1840. Father of Mary E. Bullock, Margaret J. Bullock, James Bullock, and William T. Bullock. Married to Elizabeth Combs Bullock. Father of Marsella Bullock and Samantha Bullock. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned at least two enslaved persons, including Ann, in Montgomery County in 1858. Fugitive from justice in Missouri in 1859. Farmer in New Madrid County, Missouri, in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in New Madrid County in 1860. Died in New Madrid County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994049, Montgomery County Births, p. 3.
